intro: Cyrtandra procera, commonly known as the tall bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Cyrtandra procera is adapted to thrive in moist, shaded environments, commonly found in rainforests.
